intro: Tithymalus subcrenatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and prefers moist, shaded habitats. Tithymalus subcrenatus is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
